content:
This is in relation to issue #6548, where a modal needs to be shown for hotkey deprecation.
Right now I have used the modal class from bootstrap. Does this look fine, or do you have some other suggestion.
hotkeyC.gif

I was wondering, that in favour of UI consistency, does this need to look like the modal that appears when we mute a stream with the 'M' hotkey? @Tim Abbott What are you suggestions?

Also, my concern:
1. When the users logs out and logs in again on the same machine, should the message be shown to him again for the same hotkey?
2. When the user logs out and another user logs in, I think the message should be displayed to him.
@Anurag Sharma I think we want a notice more similar to the panel.js implementation; a popup is too distracting.
@Tim Abbott Tried looking at panel.js. Not exactly clear in which cases it is displaying the panel. Some help?

@Anurag Sharma it's currently used for certain important notices at the top of the page like the need to setup desktop notifications, that are designed to be visible but not get in the user's way. That seems like what we want here.
